parts.text: {"word":"scacciare","priority":"N/A","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"追い払う、追い出す、払いのける","english_definition":"to drive away, chase away, expel, ward off","examples":[{"sentence":"Scacciare via i pensieri negativi.","translation":"To drive away negative thoughts.","note":"Example sentence."},{"sentence":"Il cane scacciò il gatto dal giardino.","translation":"The dog chased the cat out of the garden.","note":"Example sentence."}],"collocations":["scacciare via","scacciare un animale","scacciare un pensiero"],"synonyms":["allontanare","cacciare","respingere","mandare via"],"antonyms":["accogliere","attirare","invitare"]}],"etymology":{"value":"From the verb 'cacciare' (to hunt, chase) with the prefix 's-' (expressing removal or separation).","priority":"N/A"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/skatˈt͡ʃaːre/","syllables":"scac-cià-re"},"inflection":{"conjugation":{"present_indicative":{"io":"scaccio","tu":"scacci","lui/lei":"scaccia","noi":"scacciamo","voi":"scacciate","loro":"scacciano"},"past_historic":{"io":"scacciai","tu":"scacciasti","lui/lei":"scacciò","noi":"scacciammo","voi":"scacciaste","loro":"scacciarono"},"imperfect_indicative":{"io":"scacciavo","tu":"scacciavi","lui/lei":"scacciava","noi":"scacciavamo","voi":"scacciavate","loro":"scacciavano"},"future_indicative":{"io":"scaccerò","tu":"scaccerai","lui/lei":"scaccerà","noi":"scacceremo","voi":"scaccerete","loro":"scacceranno"},"subjunctive":{"present":{"io":"scacci","tu":"scacci","lui/lei":"scacci","noi":"scacciamo","voi":"scacciate","loro":"scaccino"},"imperfect":{"io":"scacciassi","tu":"scacciassi","lui/lei":"scacciasse","noi":"scacciassimo","voi":"scacciaste","loro":"scacciassero"}},"conditional":{"present":{"io":"scaccerei","tu":"scacceresti","lui/lei":"scaccerebbe","noi":"scacceremmo","voi":"scaccereste","loro":"scaccerebbero"}},"imperative":{"tu":"scaccia","voi":"scacciate"},"gerund":"scacciando","past_participle":"scacciato"}}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Scacciare' implies a forceful removal or driving away. It can be used for both concrete and abstract things.","priority":"N/A"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Scacciare a","correct":"Scacciare","note":"'Scacciare' does not require the preposition 'a' after it."}],"priority":"N/A"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["scacciata (noun: a type of flatbread from Sicily)","scacciapensieri (noun: literally 'thought-chaser', a type of jaw harp)"],"phrasal_verbs":[]},"level_frequency":{"level":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"Relatively infrequent.","priority":"N/A"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"The verb 'scacciare' is used to describe the act of forcefully removing or driving something away, whether it's a physical object, an animal, or an abstract concept like a thought or fear. It's more formal than a simple 'mandare via' (send away) and implies a more active effort to get rid of something unwanted."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"Bisogna scacciare i dubbi e agire con decisione.","translation":"One must dispel doubts and act decisively.","type":"verb","meaning_category":"drive away (abstract)"},{"sentence":"Ho cercato di scacciare le mosche dalla cucina.","translation":"I tried to chase the flies out of the kitchen.","type":"verb","meaning_category":"drive away (physical)"}]}
